data.message: Facebook I'd Like an explanation as to why my account as been blocked for 30 days for sharing a stupid photo. Are you people serious right now? The photo was sexually suggestive not nude so why was my account blocked for this stupid reason I'd like to know! So angry right now

replies.message: We hear your frustration, Anna. If you think you may have been blocked by mistake, you can file an appeal here: http://bit.ly/2e2bLr0. -Jessica
fb can you see my messages (messenger) for you? Please help me ..
Please help me get back on Facebook, I forgot my password and made up another,but they say  its not correct????
Facebook why do you not have decent customer service?

My wife's account has been blocked, too.  Facebook is demanding that she show them her photo ID and/or social security card to "prove her age".  She's had the account for nearly 10 years.  If she doesn't, they said that her account will be deleted permanently. They refuse to answer any questions about it, and I'm close to going to the news and making a big story on this crap.

Hi, Paul. We require everyone using Facebook to use their real name and birthday. This way, you always know who you're connecting with. When we discover accounts that look fake or like they’re using fake information, we ask the owner to confirm that they are who they say they are. In most cases, the easiest way to confirm your identity is to follow the on-screen steps to enter your mobile phone number and request a code.

If can't verify your account using your mobile number, you'll need to provide a copy of your photo ID. This could be a scanned copy or a close-up photo you've taken. We'll permanently delete this document after we resolve your issue. Review what types of IDs we accept: http://bit.ly/2ejqbmL.

To learn about our policies, please visit the Facebook Community Standards :https://www.facebook.com/communitystandards. -Rhea
